page.title: 03ST.PETERS CHURCH CLATFORD
page.content: The beginning of the church {ST.PETERS {GOODWORTH CLATFORD}is obscure,but records show that it probably was begun by Saxons in Norman times and was rebuilt roughly in the 13 century.The building before was most probably just as small with merely a nave and chancel. The bells are rung once or twice a week.Round the church is a grass verge covered with,graves.A road called{ {CHURCH LANE}goes down beside the { {CHURCH.}By the other side of the church is a farm,but there are also alot of houses round about the church. THE STAIN GLASS WINDOWS are a very pretty sight when looked at.On the windows there are signs of Jesus being crucified.An altar is a raised table used in {RELIGION}.It was also used originally to sacrifice animals or other gifts to a God.
